column4: danbh_intrepid:i installes kde from terminal and to see how it will be i rebooted
and then changed session to kde
if you only get grub> then you're not even past the boot loader.
and when you attempt to run that command?
are you running on the live cd?
It looks to me that you're having a seriously broken system. Have you had a harddisk crash? Are all partitions mounted?
Please be patient. I got the link the first time but I am a tad busy researching the quickbooks issue for CaBlGuY
Please take me trough what happens when you attempt to boot your system.
Is this machine the same one with your linux installation?
I see. Well that might be a problem.
Hang on while I try to find some way for this to work.
Have you got a desktop live cd availible?

I'm sorry, but I have to pass on solving this issue then. If you get hold of a live cd then I can probably help you diagnose the issue. Other than that I would recomend attempting to re-install the system.
...if re-installing is an option that is.
I assume that you created a separate partition for /home and that should leave your personal files intact.
Also please take note of any error messages that may occure during installation as that will help us in debugging the issue.
